{{Infobox figure skater |name= Tai Babilonia |image= |caption= |fullname= Tai Reina Babilonia |altname= |country= [[United States]] |formercountry= |birth_date= {{birth date and age|1959|9|22}} |birth_place= [[Los Angeles, California]] |hometown= |residence= |death_date= <!-- {{death date and age|yyyy|mm|dd|yyyy|mm|dd}} (death date followed by birth date) --> |death_place= |height= |partner= |formerpartner= [[Randy Gardner (figure skater)|Randy Gardner]] |coach= |formercoach= [[John Nicks]] |choreographer= |formerchoreographer= |skating club= Los Angeles FSC |retired= |medaltemplates= <!-- see [[Template:MedalRelatedTemplates]] --> {{MedalCountry|{{URS}}}} {{MedalSport | Pairs' [[Figure skating]]}} {{MedalCompetition|[[World Figure Skating Championships|World Championships]]}} {{MedalGold| [[1979 World Figure Skating Championships|1979 Vienna]]|Pairs}} {{MedalBronze| [[1978 World Figure Skating Championships|1978 Ottawa]]|Pairs}} {{MedalBronze| [[1977 World Figure Skating Championships|1977 Tokyo]]|Pairs}} }} '''Tai Reina Babilonia''' (born September 22, 1959 in [[Los Angeles, California]]) is a retired [[United States of America|American]] [[pair skater]]. With partner [[Randy Gardner (figure skater)|Randy Gardner]], she was the 1979 [[World Figure Skating Championships|World Champion]] and the 1976-1980 [[U.S. Figure Skating Championships|U.S. national champion]].
==Career== Babilonia & Gardner began skating together when Babilonia was eight years old and Gardner was ten. Their coach was [[John Nicks]]. The pair were five-time gold medalists at the [[U.S. Figure Skating Championships]] and won the gold medal at the 1979 [[World Figure Skating Championships]]. They were medal favorites at the 1980 [[Figure skating at the 1980 Winter Olympics|Olympics]] but were forced to withdraw due to an injury to Gardner.
Babilonia was the first figure skater of partial [[African American]] descent to win U.S. and World titles{{Citation needed|date=November 2009}}. She is also part [[Filipino people|Filipino]] on her father's side and part [[Native Americans in the United States|Native American]].<ref>http://notablefilipinos.com/USA.htm</ref> In the late '70s and early '80s, however, her mixed ethnic ancestry was rarely discussed by the media.
While skating as a professional, Babilonia became addicted to amphetamines and alcohol and attempted suicide via an overdose of sleeping pills in the fall of 1988.<ref name="People Magazine p. 159">People Magazine, May 26, 2008 Vol. 69, No. 20, p. 159: "Together Forever"</ref> After receiving treatment, she returned to the ice.
Babilonia appeared in the 2006 [[Fox Broadcasting Company|FOX]] television program ''[[Skating with Celebrities]]'', partnered with Olympic gold medalist [[Bruce Jenner]] ([[Decathlon]]).
In 2008, Babilonia and Gardner announced their retirement from professional figure skating due to a neck injury suffered by Gardner and their advancing ages.<ref name="People Magazine p. 159"/> She currently (December 2009) resides in [[Ashland, Oregon]].<ref>[http://www.taibabilonia.com/bio1.html Tai Babilonia's Official Website, December 20, 2009]</ref><ref>[http://www.mailtribune.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20081121/NEWS/811210316 Mail Tribune November 21, 2008]</ref> <ref>[http://www.oregonlive.com/news/index.ssf/2008/11/tai_babilonia_hangs_up_her_ska.html Oregon Live LLC November 23, 2008]</ref> She also designs with Bear Hill Sports an activewear line called ''Tai''.<ref>[http://www.lifeskate.com/skate/2009/05/tai-babilonia-nyc-interview-videostory.html Lifeskate.com, May 25, 2009]</ref>
On March 27, 2010, Tai was the guest of honor at the first One Step Closer HIV AIDS benefit for The AIDS Resource Foundaiton for Children <ref>[http://web.icenetwork.com/news/article.jsp?ymd=20100412&content_id=9243626&vkey=ice_pressrelease]</ref><ref>[http://absoluteskating.com/reports/2010onestepcloser.html]</ref>
==Personal==
Babilonia has a son, Scout Gabriel (born in February 1995), with her ex-husband Cary Butler, whom she married in 1992 and divorced in 1997.<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0044962/bio Tai Babilonia - Biography<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> She is currently engaged{{When|date=November 2009}} to comedian [[David Brenner]].<ref name="People Magazine p. 159"/>
